business.headline: Niva Bupa Health Insurance IPO Day 3: Check latest subscription, GMPNiva Bupa Health Insurance IPO: The public issue has seen moderate interest and allotment for the Niva Bupa Health Insurance IPO is likely to be finalised on Tuesday, November 12, 2024.

Should you buy LIC shares after Q2 results? Here's what brokerages suggestLIC reported a 4% year-on-year (YoY) decline in standalone net profit, amounting to Rs 7,621 crore for the quarter ending September 2024.
Sensex, Nifty close flat amid volatile trading; Asian Paints down 8%The S&P BSE Sensex added 9.83 points to close at 79,496.15, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 6.90 points to end at 24,141.30.

Flipkart, Amazon under scrutiny for foreign investment violations: ReportWalmart-owned Flipkart and Amazon, both of which are experiencing rapid growth in India's Rs 70 billion e-commerce market, face rising regulatory scrutiny.

JSW Holdings shares hit all-time high, surging 70% in just 4 sessionsJSW Holdings Ltd shares: The rally has positioned the stock as one of the year's top performers, delivering multibagger returns with a 228.18% rise on a year-to-date (YTD) basis.
Goodbye, Vistara: Airline set for final flight today as it merges with Air IndiaThe Vistara airline began its operations on January 9, 2015, with an inaugural flight from Delhi to Mumbai.
Bitcoin rallies past $81,000. What's driving the surge?Bitcoin surged past $81,000 for the first time, hitting a record high on Monday with its market cap reaching $1.6 trillion.
Rupee plunges to all-time low of 84.38 against US dollarThe rupee dropped to a new low of 84.3875 in early trading, surpassing its previous record set last Friday.
Swiggy IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Swiggy IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status by logging in to the BSE website or the registrar Link Intime India's portal.
Sensex, Nifty open flat despite gains in IT and auto stocks The S&P BSE Sensex was down 48.63 points to 79,437.69, while the Nifty50 lost 20.40 points to 24,127.80.

Ruchir Sharma on why billionaires support 'crazy capitalist' Donald TrumpDespite his 'crazy capitalist' persona, Donald Trump's pro-business approach continues to win over America's influential elites and billionaires.

Cryptocurrencies here to stay as an asset class, says Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma explained why cryptocurrencies, alongside gold, are emerging as long-term alternatives to traditional assets, particularly the US dollar.

China's stimulus may stabilise economy, but won't solve crisis: Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma highlighted that China's growth is unlikely to exceed 2.5% annually over the next decade.

Only a weaker dollar will bring foreign investors back to India: Ruchir SharmaIn an interview with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal, Ruchir Sharma explained that the primary factor hindering foreign capital inflows into India is the strength of the dollar.

Should India worry about Donald Trump's tariff plans? Ruchir Sharma explainsRuchir Sharma warned that under Donald Trump, India must brace for a more transactional approach, where deals could be made based on America's interests.

Booking plans job cuts as part of company's reorganisation planBooking Holdings, which owns brands like Booking.com and Kayak, did not disclose how many jobs would be affected but said it expected to provide more details on timing, likely impact on employees and financials "in due course".

Elon Musk's Tesla hits $1 trillion market value after Trump winThe electric automaker's shares jumped 8.2 per cent to $321.22, catapulting the company's valuation above the trillion-dollar mark for the first time in more than two years.

A woman's soulmate is another woman: Kalli Purie at Business Today MPW 2024Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, delivered the vote of thanks at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024 awards.

Watch: Trailblazers awarded at Business Today's Most Powerful Women 2024Business Today unveiled the 21st edition of its Most Powerful Women in Business list on Friday, celebrating 60 exceptional women leaders who are pioneering change, driving growth, and inspiring progress across diverse industries. This year's edition brings in 12 fresh faces and recognises four returning achievers, underscoring the dynamic nature of leadership in business. Watch the award ceremony here on India Today.

I salute the trailblazers: Kalli Purie at Business Today's Most Powerful Women eventKalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, India Today Group, lauded the growing accomplishments and transformation of women leaders in India.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Milind Deora calls Aaditya Thackeray 'outsider' in Worli Sena vs Sena battleMilind Deora, the Shiv Sena's Worli candidate, accused his rival faction leader Aaditya Thackeray of opposing central projects in Maharashtra and doing "speed-breaker politics".

Siddaramaiah admits exchequer burdened due to guarantees but won't stop themSiddaramaiah rejected BJP's claims of fiscal mismanagement in Congress-ruled states. He said the five guarantees in Karnataka would be implemented for five years, despite admitting to the state exchequer being burdened due to the welfare schemes.

11 militants killed in Manipur after they attack military camp, 1 jawan injuredThe armed militants had also attacked the Borobekra Police Station and set three-four abandoned houses belonging to the Meitei community in Jakuradhor, on fire.

BJP seeks action against Rahul Gandhi for 'spreading lies', approaches poll panelA delegation of the BJP met the Chief Election Officer (CEO) and urged him to act against the Congress MP Rahul Gandhi for "gross violation" of the Model Code of Conduct.

Will Kamala Harris become president despite losing to Trump? Will that be right?While Kamala Harris has conceded defeat in the US elections, a section of Democrats are asking Joe Biden to step down and give the US its first woman President. While Harris is running the administration for all practical purposes, almost acting as the President of the US (POTUS), will it be fair on Americans to thrust upon a candidate who lost the popular vote?

Should Uddhav have been Chief Minister face of MVA? Aaditya Thackeray respondsHighlighting Uddhav Thackeray's widespread popularity, Aaditya underscored how the former Maharashtra Chief Minister is regarded as the "most trusted person in the state today".

PM congratulates Navin Ramgoolam on Mauritius poll win as Pravind Jugnauth concedesPrime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Mauritian leader Navin Ramgoolam for his victory in the country's parliamentary election as incumbent Prime Minister Pravind Jugnauth conceded defeat.

On last day, DY Chandrachud granted relief to parents seeking euthanasia for sonOn his last working day as Chief Justice, DY Chandrachud granted relief to parents seeking euthanasia for their son after a report from the Uttar Pradesh government said it agreed to cover all the man's medical expenses.

Rupali Ganguly seeks Rs 50 crore compensation from stepdaughter for defamationActor Rupali Ganguly has sent a legal notice to her stepdaughter alleging defamation and seeking Rs 50 crore in damages. The notice follows claims made by her stepdaughter that Ganguly says are damaging and false.

India's first solar power storage plant to come up in MP's Morena soonThe work for constructing the solar power storage plant in Morena, which can supply electricity during the night as well, will begin from next year and the plant will be functional by 2027.

From 1 lakh sales in 5 months in 2008 to 27 lakh till now, meet India's fav sedanFor the past 16 years, this sedan has been among the 10 best-selling cars in India every year.

Over 90 Hezbollah rockets hit Israel, many injured, vehicles damagedInitial reports suggest that the barrage of Hezbollah rockets was mostly intercepted by Israel's defence system "Iron Dome", but some managed to hit the populated areas in Haifa Bay.

Mohanlal's wife says their son works on farm in exchange for food and shelterMalayalam actor Mohanlal's wife appeared on a YouTube show where she spoke at length about their son, Pranav Mohanlal. She mentioned him working on a farm in Spain and earning no money.

Isro to develop lunar space station dedicated to the Moon by 2040Phase one of the roadmap focuses on technology development and robotic missions, including the upcoming Chandrayaan-4 sample return mission.

Indira denied Justice HR Khanna CJI's job 50 years ago. His nephew is CJI nowJustice Sanjiv Khanna took oath as the Chief Justice of India (CJI) on Monday. About 50 years ago, Justice HR Khanna, Sanjiv Khanna's uncle and then the senior-most SC judge, was denied the CJI's post by then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. A look into why Justice HR Khanna is celebrated as one of India's most fearless judges.

Gurbaz scored his eighth ODI hundred while Omarzai was effective with both bat and ball.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
